website_summaries.verdict: This set has more than enough pieces for one child, especially if they're younger. Parents with older children or multiple kids might want to look for something larger.
pros: 100 pieces, including 8 large squares, 46 small squares, 20 small triangles, 12 medium triangles and 14 tall triangles in a variety of colors
Compatible with magnetic tiles from other manufacturers
cons: Tiles may break if they fall on a hard surface, spilling magnets on the floor
Large squares only have magnets along the edges, which limits their use in building

customer_reviews.title: I don't THINK so, Picasso Tiles.
customer_reviews.text: I wouldn't say that these tiles are magnetic but more "magnetic-like." Their magnetic pull is softer than a baby duck's feathers. At an average of 50 cents a per piece, they're a decent bargain, although ALL the reputable magnetic blocks/tiles/etc. are overpriced (I'm looking RIGHT at you Magformer, though you're the best and you know it and it's CERTAINLY reflected in the price). I shot a quick video comparing the magnetic pull, and ease of play between Picasso Tiles and Magformer and the results are surprising and disappointing. Hope this was helpful!
customer_reviews.author: CurnoworNever

customer_reviews.title: Exceptional! Better than other brands!!
customer_reviews.text: These tiles are wonderful!! Kids of all ages love them - and adults love them too! We bought and tried several building tiles, including Picasso Tiles and Magformers. Shown in the pictures are orange Picasso Tiles and blue Magformers tiles. The Picasso Tiles are superior (in size, shapes, and play value)! I highly recommend these tiles! Please mark if you find my review helpful. Thank you so much!
customer_reviews.author: PeggyTop Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: definitely different from Magnatiles
customer_reviews.text: We already have Magnatiles and bc of the reviews saying PicassoTiles were basically the same if not better, I ordered these. However they feel quite different - they have different grooves along the edges. Also the largest squares don't have magnets running inside the square, only the edges, which is different from Magnatiles. These are fine, but my son is building parking garages with stalls and was using the center magnets on the large squares, so, I'll be sending these back.
customer_reviews.author: bella yogi

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality and dangerous - tile broke
customer_reviews.text: One of the blocks broke right away- poor quality. Having small magnets exposed is a huge risk for kids! Not acceptable. Returning
customer_reviews.author: Marina N. Tarasova

customer_reviews.title: Crack easily
customer_reviews.text: Ordered two sets to add to our other “name brand” set. These are compatible but crack much easier. We’ve had to throw out several already. Save your money and get the “name brand.”
customer_reviews.author: PhuongChi T Smith

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price but they are not smooth...
customer_reviews.text: I bought these because the price was great. HOWEVER I also bought them to accompany my already existing sets of megatiles. These are capatible for sure in that they connect. These have a nice variety of sizes and shapes. My only issue is that these have bumps and lines and boarders on the larger tiles. This is not an issue if you are just building but my kids like to use the tiles as driveways and streets for their little cars and matchbox cars and you can not ride over these because the surfaces are not like the other flat tiles. If you dont care about the flatness- these are perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Lindsey Berman

customer_reviews.title: Not a bargain at all!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: This product is very poorly made. It comes apart and the little magnets are everywhere! I purchased this for my kindergarten class and it did not stand up at all. I won't purchase it again. A few years ago I paid more for a similar product from a different company. That one has never come apart like this. I would not recommend this product for small children at all. The magnets are small enough to be swallowed.
customer_reviews.author: C. Long

customer_reviews.title: DANGEROUS
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT BUY. Plastic breaks apart if dropped (which will happen because they are building!) Tiny magnets thrown all over which could be fatal if a child swallows one!
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Robbins

customer_reviews.title: Can't tell the difference? Neither can I
customer_reviews.text: Magna-blocks and Picasso tiles are completely interchangeable, almost identical. picture is both kinds, mixed together. But Picasso tiles are often less pricey.
customer_reviews.author: B. Schwerin

customer_reviews.title: Thumbs down Customer Service
customer_reviews.text: When the tiles are faulty- low magnetic strength and cracked tiles- seek reimbursement Immediately. If you contact their customer service (I.e Melissa) 3 days after the one year warranty she won’t help you in any way shape or form. They do not stand behind the quality and durability of the tiles- better off going to Magna Tiles!
customer_reviews.author: Morris

customer_reviews.title: LOVE THESE TILES - FANTSTIC FOR ENCOURAGING CREATIVITY! !
customer_reviews.text: I love these tiles, but more importantly my five year old granddaughter loves them. I bought her a couple of boxes for Christmas, so she would have enough to build some fantastic structures. On her very first attempt, she made something very creative and imaginative and beautiful, I think. These tiles are fantastic - I am so happy that I bought them. They are significantly less expensive than the more well known brand, but I see no difference at all. This is a great purchase for any child who enjoys spending time using his or her imagination building things.
customer_reviews.author: New Yorker

customer_reviews.title: Good deal, basically the same as name brand
customer_reviews.text: Great addition to our magnatile collection. Slightly less quality feel than the name brand, but got them on lightning deal for less than half of the name brand— worth it! Love the colors, love that the work with the name brand (this is definitely a toy where you need a ton so kiddos can build everything in their imagination. 100 seems like a lot, but it’s not!) The one thing that is hard for me is that the tall triangles don’t form a circle when you put them all together (like pizza slices) there’s a gap, which makes my eye twitch. But my boys don’t notice.
customer_reviews.author: A. Hahn

customer_reviews.title: By far the best xmas gift/toy, that is still holding my toddler's interest.
customer_reviews.text: How many of you have toddlers who get a bunch of toys from well-meaning relatives, that they look at for 5 seconds and then it collects dust? ME! But, these tiles are the first thing he asks to play with (he's supervised so he doesn't do something dumb like eat the magnets), and he's still going strong nearly a week after Christmas. I also have fun building with him. They are strong magnets, stick together well, but also easily come apart for a frustration-free building session (and a satisfying demolition session). Great value, especially compared to the m****tiles version, and just as good!
customer_reviews.author: Top Chef

customer_reviews.title: Not durable at all
customer_reviews.text: They are super fun but do not stand up to everyday play for my six year old. For the price, I expected much better durability. We have only had them for 2 months.
customer_reviews.author: me I am

customer_reviews.title: Quality product
customer_reviews.text: Grandson loves magnetic tiles. Builds with them almost every day. These were added to his collection and did not disappoint. HIS only complaint is that the large triangles when laid out flat on the floor to form a "pizza" shaped circle, don't quite make a perfect "pie" shape. A small gap is left after 12 of them are placed side to side. If each triangle was exactly 30 degrees (which they are not...maybe half a degree shy), then they would fit together nicely to form a perfect circle. Other than that, great tiles and they mesh with the other brands we already own.
customer_reviews.author: John A. Leftakis

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality, beautiful colours, an every day favourite two years on.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this over two years ago. My children were 1.5 years and 3.5 years at the time. Not only do they play with it every single day (and ask that we take it with us whenever we go visit family and friends), but all kids around join in too. Quality is excellent (they went through a phase where they would topple their built structures and laugh as they fall, but none of the tiles ever broke, magnets are still strong), colours are beautiful, and they inspire creativity and understanding of structures.
customer_reviews.author: Madioe

customer_reviews.title: Adults love them too!
customer_reviews.text: We got these for our toddler for her 3rd bday. Im not sure if her, myself, or my husband like them more. We all have a lot of fun with them. The magnets seem to be rather strong and durable. My daughter throws herself at them to take them down and they are holding up perfectly. It was hard whether to choose this brand or the more commonly known one but I couldnt justify the price jump and we love these.
customer_reviews.author: Connor Peoples

customer_reviews.title: These Blocks are the BEST!!
customer_reviews.text: Love these "blocks". The adults as well as the children play with these magnetic blocks. I bought a set last year and it was such a "hit" that I bought a second set this year. Our Grandson was very happy to add this set to his other set. Now he/we can build towers up to the ceiling! There are plenty of blocks for building and to use as "decorations" on the buildings. They are flat and need very little storage room which is definitely a big plus!
customer_reviews.author: Karen S. Donovan

customer_reviews.title: Perfectly good quality at an excellent price.
customer_reviews.text: Yes, Magnatiles are slightly more durable and slightly higher quality, but these are a much better value and also plenty good quality. We've had the set for 2 months now with no issues. No cracks, all the magnets hold well, and the kids love building 5-foot towers. 95% of the quality at 1/3 the cost is no-brainer. The kids didn't have enough pieces to really mess around with our Magnatile set, and the cost of 100 tiles would have been prohibitive. It's a toy, and overall the "fun per dollar" of the Picasso Tiles is just so much better.
customer_reviews.author: Zane T. Rocknebaugh

customer_reviews.title: Encourage imagination and creativity
customer_reviews.text: This is hands down one of the Top 3 toys my easily bored 2 year old owns. In addition to the early introduction to geometry, one valuable takeaway from this toy is the lesson of persistence. My little perfectionist gets extremely frustrated when her creations don’t work out or collapse and has learned to try again and rebuild/improve. 100 pieces originally sounded like plenty but we’ve reached a point where they are now limiting. Additional pieces and new shapes will further encourage her creativity and imagination so she can build taller, more complex structures and castles.
customer_reviews.author: liz7435

customer_reviews.title: Picasso Magnetic Tiles are GREAT!
customer_reviews.text: My 3 & 5 year old great granddaughters love the Magna-tiles that I purchased last year, but they always seems to need more to complete their projects so I looked at the reviews on the Picasso Tiles since they're a lot less expensive, and took a chance and ordered a 100 piece set and they're GREAT! The girls love the new bright colors and so far we've not seen any difference in the products. I'll be looking at more of the Picasso sets if needed going forward.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Towers fall
customer_reviews.text: Towers fall. One of the things children love to do with building blocks or tiles or whatever the medium is to build towers. Towers fall and the building material needs to withstand that. However Picasso magnetic tiles aren't equipped to handle such things. The come loose and don't attract as well once fallen or dropped. These are pricey and should be better made. Very disappointed in quality. Outstanding concept!
customer_reviews.author: Dibberodale

customer_reviews.title: Not great, but good...
customer_reviews.text: The price for the size of the set is competitive with the other sets (only if it's on sale) but the magnets are not as strong as a second set I purchased recently. Over all my kids still like building with it and they dont really notice the difference in the strength of the magnets but the second set is of a better quality for the same price.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly H.

customer_reviews.title: So much fun!!!
customer_reviews.text: Loves these tiles! They are so much fun for my grandkids. I ordered one set and it wasn’t enough do I just ordered a second one! They build and create for hours and see so entertained with these tiles. My only problem is they always seem to need more. I would love a couple more but they are spendy ... the only drawback. For a 3 and 6 year old they play for hours building and putting their little toys in the castles, barns or whatever they choose to call them in their imagination!!
customer_reviews.author: TeeJae

customer_reviews.title: Picasso magnetic tiles are the best!
customer_reviews.text: These tiles are my 4 younger grandchildren’s favorite gift! The 5 year olds create amazing structures and by naming and sorting shapes and counting out pieces needed for what they want to make they are using math skills without even realizing it. So far I have purchased 5 sets of these, the latest for my youngest granddaughter’s 3rd birthday. The colors are beautiful, the magnets strong enough to build towers and buildings, and the fun is endless. When in doubt but the larger set. My grandkids say you can never have too many! The box is sturdy enough to encourage sorting and repacking when they are done playing which is a definite plus for parents. We love Picasso Tiles!
customer_reviews.author: Dianne

customer_reviews.title: Super great activity
customer_reviews.text: All around wonderful quality. Kids love these. I purchased because the preschool/daycare my don goes to has these and it is one of the schools favorite and most loved toys (though they have the name brand blocks) .. I decided to purchase this lesser expensive version of the favorite activity toy and I am so happy. You aren't compromising quality or design at all by choosing to purchase and my kids love these.. Oh just be careful not to build structures too tall on hard surface floors because you can knock the magnets loose on the inside if they fall too far and dont have carpet to land on.
customer_reviews.author: Wildflower7200

customer_reviews.title: Works well with leading brand, good quality
customer_reviews.text: My mom purchased Manga tiles for my son’s birthday and I purchased Picasso tiles. They fit together well. No issues that I can tell. The Picasso tiles seem to have a stronger magnet and brighter colors. Also includes pink and purple. The other brand looks like it’s screwed together and Picasso must be glued and interlocking to keep the magnets inside, but other than that, I don’t see a difference. For the price, I’d definitely buy Picasso tiles again. My mom was wishing she has done the same. So much more for the money. The pack of 100 seems like plenty!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Grandson loves them
customer_reviews.text: It was a birthday gift for my grandson . He plays with them for hours. I bought this set and another set of the Picasso building blocks with the alphabet and cars. I read a lot of reviews between these and the mega blocks. I went with the Picasso because they are basically the same plus you get double for half the price. I think its more an adult thing then a childs thing on which is better. He loves them and that's what matters.
customer_reviews.author: Gina Mar

customer_reviews.title: Broken tile
customer_reviews.text: My daughters (2&3) love these tiles and this is the second box I’ve bought so that they can expand what they can create. That being said, my daughter showed me a broken tile today (2 days after receiving). The magnet is rattling loose and will need to be trashed. It’s not to say that these aren’t worth it, but do be aware, and maybe check them when they arrive as I believe this one probably got to us like this.
customer_reviews.author: Attigus

customer_reviews.title: INFERIOR TO PLAYMAGS
customer_reviews.text: My kids play with these tiles all the time at their school and we thought it would be good to have a couple sets at home. Our girls got two sets of tiles for Christmas, one Playmags and one Picasso tiles, and while the sizes and shapes are the same(and compatible with each other), the magnets on the Picasso tiles are NOT as strong. Often falling over or collapsing, the Picasso tiles are much more difficult to build with for my 2 year old and moderately more difficult for my 4 year old. All in all I ended up returning the Picasso tiles.
customer_reviews.author: The Fairway Woodsman

customer_reviews.title: Great for my 2 year old
customer_reviews.text: My 2 year old son loves these!! We bought them for an early bday present and he plays with them everyday. He definitely had to learn how to piece them together but after a week or two of playing with us he has it down and we maybe enjoyed it more than him! They are super durable - my son has thrown them, stepped on them etc and we have not had any issues with them breaking or cracking. We are always with him when he plays with them to make sure because of the magnets. I had debated between these and the other brands but glad we went with these, great value for a great product!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: These are awesome!!
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for my 2 1/2-yr-old grandson that has these at daycare. His mom had said that he is almost always playing with them when she picks him up and sure enough, (as they spent 4 days at our house), he played with them at least 60% of each day. They are so easy for young children to put together to make things. They also seem very sturdy. He built things and always knocked them over, (not gently), stepped on them, threw them, etc. I'm very impressed with these and will be getting some for my house.
customer_reviews.author: jill Bagley

customer_reviews.title: Very comparable to magnatiles
customer_reviews.text: My 3&4 year old love magnatiles, however because of price we didnt have alot of them. They were constantly fighting over them so I had been shopping around for something that was similar. I was hesitant at first after reading some reviews but these are almost exactly the same. My girls haven't even noticed a difference. Personally I feel like they are slightly less magnetic however for the amount you get its definitely worth it to me. They have been playing with them constantly
customer_reviews.author: bondlife

customer_reviews.title: My kids absolutely loved these! They are lots of fun and lend ...
customer_reviews.text: My kids absolutely loved these! They are lots of fun and lend to a childs creativity. The price is good compared to similar products. We previously purchased Magformers and my daughter really enjoyed playing with them so we wanted to get more. Since they were more pricey, we opted for the Picasso tiles. Unfortunately, upon falling on the floor, a few have popped open, spilling the magnets all over the floor. With an 11 month old baby cruising my home, the risk is too high. I'm sad to return them but the one downfall is a big one! I wish they were more securely fashioned together!
customer_reviews.author: 1HAPPYMAMA

customer_reviews.title: Favorite toy for years!
customer_reviews.text: We just bought a second set because my kids loved the first one so much. These have been played with nearly every day for 2 years straight. Never had any break or crack. Every kid that comes to our house plays with them. I love all the different ways to build with them. My son got a set of magformers for his birthday but didn’t like them as well as these, they’re basically only used for fridge magnets now.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley

customer_reviews.title: great toy, good quality, compatible with magna-tiles
customer_reviews.text: this is one of my oldest daughter's favorite toys. we've definitely gotten way more than our money's worth in terms of playtime with this toy. we own a set of these and also a set of magna-tiles, and have given sets to other friend's kids as gifts also. in terms of quality these are very high quality, the same as magna-tiles, and also compatible with magna-tiles. highly recommended and a must have for any families with young children!
customer_reviews.author: Ray H Tsai

customer_reviews.title: Kids love them, save the money and buy these instead of name brand
customer_reviews.text: My 9 &4 year old really enjoy these. I reviewed several brands read tons of reviews and decided on these. Glad i did, great value alot better than spending on magnatiles Update: after playing eith these for a few weeks i have to take away some stars because now they are bored with regualr building anf they are teying to create masterpieces they can play with and move around YOU CANT MOVE THE BOXES YOU CREATE WITHOUT THEM COLLAPSING so i think they are great for the money but the next set i will look into some with stronger magnets:)
customer_reviews.author: Dee

customer_reviews.title: Our kids love them!!
customer_reviews.text: We have two kids (5&2) and both of them LOVE these tiles! The magnets are strong and seem to be very secure inside each tile. We had looked at another brand that was close to double the price but after reading many reviews on here, decided to go with these and we are so glad we did! We ended up getting a second box of the 100 set after the first arrived. We are very happy with these!!
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Brunson

customer_reviews.title: Great price, great quality
customer_reviews.text: I’ve said numerous times, if we had to decide only one of our kids many toys to keep, it would be the magnet tiles. The Picasso Tiles brand are great quality with a way better price than other brands. We have added multiple sets through the years so we can have lots. My kids get so creative with them, and we store in a plastic storage bin so we can bring them on trips. My kids are currently 4,7&10, and they all love playing with them. You seriously can’t go wrong with any age or gender with these. Even my husband and I play with them sometimes.
customer_reviews.author: Jeanine

customer_reviews.title: As good as the other "Name Brand"
customer_reviews.text: I am a self proclaimed label lover. I am hesitant to try the knock offs but after reading 100s of reviews I gave these a try. My children excitedly tore into the box and spent hours playing this afternoon. They are interchangeable with the magnitiles and I see no difference in magnetic ability, size, or weight. Very happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: NolanT

customer_reviews.title: Excellent toy with plenty of playtime!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my grandson for our house. When he opened the box, he was delighted. He played all morning long with them. We have a coffee table that has steel on top so it is perfect for building on. Every week when he comes over he goes right to them to play with. Definitely one of the biggest hits toys-wise for our 4 year old grandson. I think I will add to the set as time goes on since he enjoys these building tiles so much. Very happy with my purchase! In fact, his parents bought him a set after seeing how fun and creative these are. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Sharon R Paavola

customer_reviews.title: Kids spend HOURS playing with them!!
customer_reviews.text: We received a 60 piece set for Christmas and our 2 and 5 year old girls love them!! They are easy to use but they are still able build some awesome towers and buildings with them. The girls loved them so much that we ordered the 100 piece set as well! Now they can make even bigger buildings with them and they have enough to both make big designs! They spend HOURS playing with them and we are even thinking about buying another set so they can build even more things with them!! I would recommend this product to anyone with kids! Even my wife and I enjoy creating buildings with out kids!!!
customer_reviews.author: Ypsibrave06

customer_reviews.title: Better than Magna Tiles
customer_reviews.text: I am a kindergarten teacher and these were purchased for use in my classroom. These are hands down the favorite manipulative in my room by the majority of students. I have a set of Magna Tiles but I have found these hold up much better. They don't scratch as easily and have bolder brighter colors. I would highly recommend these!
customer_reviews.author: jend

customer_reviews.title: Incredible, engaging, creative toy!
customer_reviews.text: Child plays with this non-stop. Comes up with building ideas that I didn’t think possible. Such a great, creative and fun toy. This is third set I have purchased. Purchased 2 sets for my child, one for his Kindergarten class and will be purchasing one for my Art Classes for students to use as a center when they finish their art projects early.
customer_reviews.author: mindi mcnair

customer_reviews.title: Not strong at all.
customer_reviews.text: The magnetic is not strong. Tried to build something and it kept collapsing. Not strong magnet at all. I read all the reviews and thought okay I’m gonna give it a try, but now I wish that I got magnatiles instead of this cheap crap. I am not satisfied with the product at all. It does not stand on its own. My little one loves playing with this, but he gets frustrated that it keeps collapsing when he tries to build something. This is obviously cheaper than magnatiles. If you are hesitating between magnatiles and this product (and if the price isn’t your concern) I’d recommend magnatiles.
customer_reviews.author: JK

customer_reviews.title: Cracked after a few days.
customer_reviews.text: A few days in and a handful of tiles are cracked. The cracks are all in the center of the tiles. We’ve had a set of the magnatile brand for 5 years and not one of the tiles is cracked. I won’t be buying this brand again.
customer_reviews.author: Rebekah Hammang

customer_reviews.title: Best Toy Purchase!
customer_reviews.text: These are wonderful. I was a teacher for years and my kiddos always loved the expensive brand of these. Now, my daughter talks about them when she comes home from daycare. We saw these pop up on Amazon and I thought I would give them a try. She loves these and they get so much use. I see her creative juices flowing while she tries to figure out what to build next. I'm so glad we purchased them and I will be buying more to add to her set.
customer_reviews.author: k

customer_reviews.title: Unsafe
customer_reviews.text: Its my first time writing a bad review on Amazon. We got this item for my 3 yr old son. He likes it, however this product is not safe to play with because the edge is so sharp. The edge cut my sons finger and also when he was excited with the magnet slides, its so easy to cut in the kids skin. He got a scare on his face too because the sharp edge cut in his eye lids. I would never want my kids to play this toy ever again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Endless hours of entertainment
customer_reviews.text: My kids have been playing with these since the moment they got them as a Christmas present. I like how they utilize their imaginations. The pieces are also big enough that they are easy to clean up, and you are not constantly finding them around the house like legos and other toys with small toys.
customer_reviews.author: joshua

customer_reviews.title: Great for imagination!
customer_reviews.text: One set was originally received as a present; with its colorful and various shapes it lends much to the imagination of the young mind. Our 20 month old granddaughter loved her 31⁄2 year old brother's set so much we invested in a set for her. With the 2 sets there is no lack of buildings, spaceships and exotic creatures. They are used daily and carefully stored away each night.
customer_reviews.author: Kiddoo

customer_reviews.title: Just perfect
customer_reviews.text: It is easy to assemble "towers", "castles", "garages" or whatever else my kids come up with. They love building anything and everything. My middle child loves the color spectrum and organizing as such. My oldest just wants to build bigger and bigger stuff! Any kid about 2 or older can have fun with these. Younger than that, they will just knock them down and annoy the older siblings!
customer_reviews.author: Jarrett Dunn

customer_reviews.title: engineer encouragement
customer_reviews.text: My grandsons build with utterly everything. Legos are the go-to at their other grandparents house. So I wanted a different building experience toy at my house. Magnets are Always THE first toy they go find from my toy box. I've added to my Discovery Toys magnets once already, but wanted more shapes, and frankly, more magnets for the less expense. These magnets do not match up very well with the Discovery set, but they do work fabulous on their own.....and there are 100 pieces.
customer_reviews.author: Beth M.

customer_reviews.title: An amazing set!!
customer_reviews.text: We have played with this EVERY SINGLE DAY since we got it in the mail! My kids have not gotten tired of it since there’s endless ways to play with it and an endless amount of things to create with this set!! Might need to purchase more since all the kids get really excited about building their structures that they ended up using most of them up!
customer_reviews.author: Lizbeth Marin

customer_reviews.title: We love our Picasso tiles!
customer_reviews.text: I like that these are solid, and a good size. I’m always impressed with the creations that my 5 yo and 3 yo make, and I can tell they are learning. We’ve had them for 3 months. One piece broke in that time.
customer_reviews.author: Heidi

customer_reviews.title: Worth the savings over other brands
customer_reviews.text: We love these. If you’re struggling to decide between all of the different brands of this toy: 1. Stop stressing, these really are wonderful. 2. Our 5 and 3 year olds have walked across these sprawled out on the carpet multiple times, and they haven’t cracked. 3. These things are not going to hold a shape enough to toss around or anything, but they make some great structures. 4. These are absolutely worth the cost to have more tiles for less money. I would for sure buy this set over again.
customer_reviews.author: Kristin

customer_reviews.title: Just the right size and magnet strength for a toddler
customer_reviews.text: I got these for my daughter who just turned two. They’re the perfect size for her little hands and the magnets also aren’t too strong that she can’t get them apart. She absolutely loves them and gets so much entertainment out of them. My only gripe is that that thin skinny triangles that look like pizza slices do not make a perfect circle. Other than that, we love building with them and I love how they can all be stuck together and stored taking up very little space.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley M.

customer_reviews.title: Still A Favorite!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these for my toddlers a little over a year ago and they still get played with DAILY. These are definitely one of the top favorite toys in our household. The magnets stay together great and even with the daily crashing of the towers they have held up wonderfully. (A few do have a small crack, but my toddlers are literally monsters stomping on buildings with these sometimes) I would definitely purchase these again. I have even recommended them to several friends over the last year+ !
customer_reviews.author: Sabrina

customer_reviews.title: Great gift, Grows with child
customer_reviews.text: This is such a fun set of blocks!!! We got this for my 3 year old for her birthday! Only issue is that many of the larger pieces don’t “stick” to each other very well, so you’re stuck with the same old block problem you have with regular building blocks. That being said my 3 children under 5 all enjoy this and has definitely something that will grow with them as their creativity and dexterity grows
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie

customer_reviews.title: No quality issues or breaks. Magnet strenth better (slightly) than Magnatile.
customer_reviews.text: I was hesitant to buy this after reading some review that says the Picasso tiles have quality issue and easily breaks. However, I also read more recent reviews that the quality improved and no issue were found. I went with the recent reviews and I am happy to say I saved 50% compared to the Magna Tile. There is no sign of weak plastic or poor construction of the tiles. Also, I actually see a slight better magnet strength in Picasso compared to Magna tile, which helps to build taller structures. My toddler loves these.
customer_reviews.author: JC

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my 5 year old granddaughter to keep her busy with the current situation. After she received it she sent me a video of some of the things she made with the magnetic tiles. They look great. She said she loves playing with it! I also bought her the the blocks set. She hasn’t received that one yet but I know she will love it. My daughter told me how well made the tiles are and how many different combinations of things she can make. It’s a perfect kit for all ages.
customer_reviews.author: Patti

customer_reviews.title: Perfect! Just like magnatiles, great quality
customer_reviews.text: These are just as good, if not better, than Magnatiles and for a fraction of the cost! I paid $50 for a 100 piece set versus $120 for magnatiles 100 piece set. My 4 year old does not know the difference. We use them with our glow in the dark magnatiles and they work well together. He still doesn’t know the difference. I can’t see any reason why you would pay more for the magnatiles name when it’s the same damn thing, just difference design/look on the plastic.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: So much fun!
customer_reviews.text: My son received a small set of magformers for Christmas and we wanted a bigger set to be able to build bigger creations. I wasn’t really concerned with them working with the magformers because these were a great price. They work with the magformers a little, but they’re different sizes, so the magnets are in different spots. In the picture the magformers are mostly to the right and these are mostly to the left, so you can see the size difference. My 4 year old is not gentle and so far they seem pretty durable.
customer_reviews.author: Deena

customer_reviews.title: PERFECT!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased these for my daycare and the kids absolutely LOVE them!! I like the fact that the magnets are in-cased within the shape instead of just in a groove, this makes for longevity and sanitizing, and safety from magnets falling out and possibly causing a chocking hazard They would build all day long if I let them. I feel this is a really good value given all the pieces in the set. I would surely recommend and I'm thinking about purchasing another set :-)
customer_reviews.author: Jeri H.

customer_reviews.title: Wish I would have bought the other ones!
customer_reviews.text: My kids play with these tiles a lot especially for their ages...2 and 1. BUT the magnetic hold is very weak! Even though the price is great for how many you get, I wish I would have bought the magformers. Another thing I don't like is the larger triangles, if you try laying them side by side to make a circle, there is an inch or so gap between the first and last tile so my 2 year old asks me to fix it. So not a complete waste of money as my kids do play with them and you can build something tall...it just breaks down easily.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great and durable
customer_reviews.text: I run a Martial Arts Academy and bought these for our Summer Camp and After School programs. Kids love them!! They have been dropped multiple times, I mean a lot; and none have cracked yet so I believe they are sturdy. Very colorful and good variety of shapes. Plus they were cheaper than the major brand.
customer_reviews.author: Luis Gines

customer_reviews.title: A Must Have for a Toddler
customer_reviews.text: Definitely a must buy. My girls and their cousins can’t get enough. I love seeing their little minds work and have them discover what they can build. Creativity is furthered, it entertains them for a really long time which is always a plus and offers a good mental challenge. My eldest now begs for more shapes and pieces to build new ideas. Wish I had seen and bought this earlier. I would recommend to all parents, and already have amongst my friends.
customer_reviews.author: R. Boats...

customer_reviews.title: Keeps them occupied for hours
customer_reviews.text: My grandsons 3&6 are occupied for 2-3 hours at a time with these Picasso magnetic tiles. I first bought the 60 piece set 3 months ago and they enjoyed them so much we needed more so they wouldn't fight over them. This time I bought the 100 piece set and highly recommend them. There are many place in the internet if you google images for Picasso tiles you'll get ideas for what to build in addition to the children just using their imaginations.
customer_reviews.author: Ladonna Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Fun for the whole family
customer_reviews.text: We got a set of 50 for Christmas for our two kids 5 and 2. We have played with them almost everyday for the past few weeks and just ended up buying another set of 100 pieces since 50 pieces just wasn’t enough for us. The two sets combined have been great for our family of four. We also bought the base with wheels and that was a big hit with the kids.
customer_reviews.author: kbeiler17

customer_reviews.title: Picasso Tiles are my FAVORITE brand of magnet tiles
customer_reviews.text: Picasso Tiles are my FAVORITE brand of magnet tiles. In my opinion, they are better than the well-known name brand. They have a smooth finish (instead of the metal ring through the tile) and very strong magnets. Great quality, at a price better than the name brand. Pro-tip: however many tiles you think you need, get more. We have a few sets combined to at least 200 pieces total, and my kid always wants more for his projects. Also, get the train wheels/car base set. Or get a few. Those are a huge hit too. ALSO, print out the idea booklet from their website.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonMama

customer_reviews.title: Not the same as magnatiles..
customer_reviews.text: Looks almost identical to magnatiles and purchased because of all the reviews stating how almost identical they were in sturdiness and magnet strength. Easy to build and play with but have to be really gentle otherwise creation will break.. 2 year old nephew who i purchased for grew extremely frustrated while trying to hold a box and prism that was assembled.. But for older kids, it seems to be ok, just more mindful that its more fragile than magnatiles..
customer_reviews.author: Kimmie

customer_reviews.title: Why do these have such good reviews???
customer_reviews.text: These had such a high rating I didn’t even read the reviews before buying but I’m definitely disappointed. These magnets are not strong at all- if you build something you can barely move it or it will fall apart. Some are cracking already and we’ve had them a month. Seemed like a good price but it’s not a great product.
customer_reviews.author: Kim

customer_reviews.title: So much fun!
customer_reviews.text: My grandchildren (ages 2-4) love these tiles!! They stay put while building and you can stack them up high. My 2 and 4 year old grand daughters have at least 600 of these tiles and build unbelievable structures! Really wonderful tiles and promotes lots of imagination.
customer_reviews.author: jpelt

customer_reviews.title: High Quality and Great Price!
customer_reviews.text: I spent a lot of time and heavily researched all the magnet-tiles out there....and this is the set to buy. My thinking came down to this: To fully enjoy these tiles, you need a lot of them - especially if other sibs/friends are joining in on the fun. Picasso Tiles are high quality and you can buy a lot of them for MUCH CHEAPER than Magna-tiles. I got two sets for my grandchildren (along with the "must-have" red 12" by 12" plastic base) and they LOVE them!
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: Great for keeping kids busy
customer_reviews.text: These are great for keeping kids busy. It allows them to use their imagination and creativity unlIke most toys today. These tiles are very durable and safe for ages 3 and up. Having 10 grandchildren, I do not recommend these tiles for babies or toddlers as they tend to chew on things. These have magnets embedded in the hard plastic that perhaps can loosen out. Also these tiles have sharp corners and can hurt the babies or toddlers mouth if chewed on or even fallen on. This is my personal recommendation and opinion. ☺
customer_reviews.author: Susan A

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended Great quality
customer_reviews.text: My son LOVES to play with these (a daily play toy in this house) we've had no signs of wear and manufacturing is solid. They work well with other sets we have and I would recommend getting the community member figures to add to the playability. Hours of fun and creative play. Highly recommended
customer_reviews.author: LLO

customer_reviews.title: Great blocks
customer_reviews.text: Love these magnetic blocks. We have had for a few years now and they are still in pretty good shape even though my kids are really rough on them (think building stuff and dropping it down the stairs rough). A few blocks have come apart over the years but I just put the magnets back in and super glued back together, work fine still. I love them so much because they stick together so well with the magnets that my 2 year old can build major structures all by himself but aren't baby blocks so my 10 year old (& other kids between) still enjoys building with them!
customer_reviews.author: Staci

customer_reviews.title: A Good Purchase
customer_reviews.text: My three and six year olds love these. They are equally fun and challenging for both ages. They have played with these toys for many hours (whereas some toys don’t have the staying power). Only problem is now little brother can crawl over and knock the creations down easily so they have to be done up on a table instead of the floor. But I don’t have to worry about small parts - baby brother chews on them and it’s ok. Worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Jordan Tremblay

customer_reviews.title: Loved by kids. Well made the best of the tiles...absolutely recommend
customer_reviews.text: This very active little boy loves to sit and take time to build with these tiles.the quality of these tiles is exceptional..the tiles adhere to each other well.. He has several sets and they all coordinate with each other, which is very helpful. This particular company is the best! PS..forgot to mention that there are no small pieces like another favorite series of toys that my other grandchildren love.
customer_reviews.author: gretchen craig

customer_reviews.title: Best toy ever
customer_reviews.text: I saw an article on Pinterest where the mom said this was her kids favorite toy! I bought these for my son’s 4th birthday and let me tell how much he loves them. It is one of the only toys he has owned where the adults enjoy playing it with him. It actually gets us all involved because it’s so enjoyable. I am so happy I purchased this toy! 10/10 recommend
customer_reviews.author: christianna

customer_reviews.title: Great for building and imaginative play
customer_reviews.text: My five year old absolutely loves these. They keep him occupied for hours (seriously). He’ll spend a whole Saturday playing with them. He has the original Magnatiles at preschool, and cannot tell the difference. Highly recommend! We’re thinking of buying a second set so that his “inventions” can be even larger.
customer_reviews.author: rachindc

customer_reviews.title: just like the real thing
customer_reviews.text: My son LOVES magnetiles but they are so expensive. I was hesitant to purchase a knock off brand. But after reading other reviews I took the plunge on these. I couldn't be happier with this purchase!! He has mixed these with the real ones and you can barely tell the difference. And now he has so many and can be so creative and build so much more. When we need more I will be buying again!! Highly recommend!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: These are pretty fantastic. My three year old has a tendency to kick, chop, and slam his creations to the ground with gusto, so we have had a couple of tiles crack. However, they still hold together magnetically and they have held up to quite a bit of abuse. All of the kids love these, including the 12 year old cousins. They are really neat and much more affordable than other brands. We are really happy with these and plan to buy more to expand the mess... I mean, imagination.
customer_reviews.author: S

customer_reviews.title: STEM Edutainment at it's finest!
customer_reviews.text: These are a major hit in our house! The expense was absolutely worth it, these get played with daily by my 3 and 4 year olds (and my husband and I as well) there are a million things you can do with them. I can't wait to get one of the expansion sets with wheels to make vehicles for one of their birthdays. I cannot recommend this highly enough. We've played with Magna Tiles as well and I honestly couldn't tell the difference between the two if the names weren't printed on the side. They're the same size too so if we did get the other brand somewhere they could all go together.
customer_reviews.author: David Boring

customer_reviews.title: Surprised at how a simple toy has become the hands-down favorite
customer_reviews.text: At fist I was on the fence as to whether this was a good gift for an almost four year old girl. The first day, she played with it for 90 minutes nonstop. She played with it again the next two days (day 3 now) for approximately an hour daily. This gift encourages creativity and I love it. My 5 year old and 12 year old also enjoy playing with it. It's a hit. I did an unboxing on YouTube at my channel FiveGirlsAndAGuy.
customer_reviews.author: GeorgiaBoy

customer_reviews.title: Best magnetic tile set imo
customer_reviews.text: Great set! I've also purchased the other similar brand & prefer these. There's a few more of the large tiles in this set. I also bought the window set, the cars & the magnetic people. These are sanity savers, my 3 yr old twins play with them for hours almost every day. The 6, 9 & 11 yr old love them as well. They don't break easily & that's saying a lot with all my boys. They make a great gift!
customer_reviews.author: Antonio Lazaro Blas

customer_reviews.title: Great toy that my grandchildren play with most days
customer_reviews.text: I've bought 5 of these sets over the last two or three years. Two or three years ago I asked one of my daughters-in-law what would be a good Christmas present for her 3-year-old daughter and she recommended these. Since then I bought sets for two of my other grandchildren in my daughter's family. All of the children I bought them for, as well as their siblings, love these tiles. This set is a third set for the first granddaughter I got them for. With these, the more the better I've been told.
customer_reviews.author: Bonnie Dickson

customer_reviews.title: Creative and durable
customer_reviews.text: These keep my 3 and 5 year old so busy! The magnets are enclosed in the plastic so they can't fall out, which is ideal since the 8 month old likes to bang them together while watching the big kids build fun creations. The box the tiles comes in is fairly sturdy and we kept ours to put the tiles away and on a shelf when not in use. These were a grandparent gift for the 5 year old and we quickly bought a second set for the 3 year old so there would be enough tiles to go around.
customer_reviews.author: Mr&MsBark

customer_reviews.title: Not as expected
customer_reviews.text: My son always talks about the "Magna Tiles" from his school. I researched and decided these would be a more affordable substitution for the Magna Tiles. I now wish I would have splurged on the Magna Tiles. We have had them for almost a year now and my son barely plays with them because they don't always stay together. He ends up being more frustrated than happy with these. I tried playing with them as well and feel the same way. I should have returned them because now they just take up space.
customer_reviews.author: KS

customer_reviews.title: Good stuff
customer_reviews.text: Great value for the money. I do worry about my son swallowing magnets but they do seem very sturdy. My sister just got us some of the real stuff and I noticed they had little grommets in them seemingly for greater security. Not sure if that’s just overboard but just an observation. I try to make sure these are all put away after playing so that none are lying around.
customer_reviews.author: xds58

customer_reviews.title: Tiles Fall Apart
customer_reviews.text: This product is a lot of fun for my toddler. She loves them. I would have given them a 5 star review however I was putting the tiles away today and discovered 2 small magnets from one of the tiles (not sure which one) on the floor. My kid doesn’t put stuff in her mouth but this is concerning. I am also a RN and if she would swallow these pieces she would have to go in for a scope and a potential surgery...
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth

customer_reviews.title: A fabulous toy both for learning and for fun
customer_reviews.text: The Picasso magnetic tiles are fabulous. I bought them for my 3 year old granddaughter and she plays with them endlessly. We now have 3 sets so she can make huge, sprawling castles with them. Because they are magnetic they hold together beautifully, which is very satisfying for a small child. They also reinforce a beginning sense of geometry just by the way the various triangles, rectangles and squares are able to fit together. And I love to play with them too!
customer_reviews.author: Emily G.

customer_reviews.title: Well made magnetic pieces
customer_reviews.text: My kids, 5 and 1 absolutely love these magnet shapes. They can play for hours on end and still enjoy playing every single day with them. The good thing about these pieces is that they look really sturdy and well made. Even when they build something big and then break it down the pieces do not break. The only issue I had was initially receiving a used set, the box was not shrink wrapped or anything and it looked like the pieces had already been played with. I contacted amazon returned the used box and they Sent a new box right away. I was very happy with their quick resolution.
customer_reviews.author: spunkyd

customer_reviews.title: Do not pay more!
customer_reviews.text: These are excellent tiles!!! Exactly what we wanted I know there is a "brand name"- but these are perfect!! I hesitated because with toys sometimes you get what you pay for... This is not the case for these tiles.
customer_reviews.author: Chrissy M.

customer_reviews.title: Hours of Independent Play! Not perfect fit with Magnatile Brand though...
customer_reviews.text: We love these! They don't fit absolutely perfectly with the regular magnatile brand, but they aren't so far off that you still can't build with them (I think the need for perfection is worse for Mommy and Daddy than our 3yr old! lol). That said, if I had to do it all over again we would only purchase this brand because it is cheaper and works just as well as the magnatiles, but we wouldn't have gotten both sets. This honestly provides hours of independent play for my toddler, it's one of his favorite things to play with!
customer_reviews.author: Tina R.

customer_reviews.title: Keeping Busy during Crazy Times
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to buy something for my 4yr old and 2yr old that would get their minds and imagination going while we wait out this pandemic. I wanted something engaging for everyone and this did it. Everyone, husband & myself included enjoy getting on the floor with the children to create! If we run out of ideas, Pinterest has a multitude. This toy is a good way to bond and play.
customer_reviews.author: D. Marie

customer_reviews.title: I knew the child already had some but the beauty about this product is you can keep adding more for more and more fun. The first
customer_reviews.text: Purchased as a gift for the second time! I knew the child already had some but the beauty about this product is you can keep adding more for more and more fun. The first time I purchased these were for a 1 year old birthday party. After opening the gifts we spent hours playing with these. The best part as that the 1 year old has 2 sisters that are 5 and 6 and they were having just as much fun playing with these tiles. It was great seeing 3 children of different ages all playing with the same toy and seeing the differences in there play based on their individual development.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Imagination!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this set for my grandson's 5th birthday. He had played with his cousin's Picasso Tiles during a recent visit and loved them. They are very good quality and will probably last for several generations. It is nice to buy something for my grandson that doesn't make noise or require batteries. All he has to do is add his imagination!
customer_reviews.author: Bay Boy

customer_reviews.title: As good quality as magna tiles at fracture of the price
customer_reviews.text: As good quality as magna tiles at fracture of the price. Compatible with that brand as well. If your child doesn’t have those you should buy them. Multiple sets for that matter. My kids are 3,5 and 7 and we already have 200 pieces. I would say a 2 year old can start playing with those. My kids build houses, barns, roads, computers, boats, storage containers for different toys and so on.... It’s the only thing they constantly play with. These are played with every s i n g l e day. Priceless. I just bought them another 200!
customer_reviews.author: popolka

customer_reviews.title: Magnets are too weak
customer_reviews.text: Whether they are compatible with Magna-tiles or whether they are just as good as Magna-tiles are not my concern. Bottom line, the tiles are too heavy and magnets too weak to build and hold anything useful. I am kicking myself for letting them sit around for a while before opening then letting my daughter draw art work on the box before I could think of returning. Sigh.
customer_reviews.author: JK

customer_reviews.title: Nice gift for child
customer_reviews.text: We got this set for our twin grandson's for Christmas. I caught a "black friday" deal, so I was lucky on that aspect. This is a very nice set. The colors are really nice and it is sturdy, well made, and easy for little hands to make really cool things. They played with it right away on Christmas day. I didn't even know about these magnetic tiles until my daughter told me that they had a smaller set and really liked them. I am very happy I purchased these.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: PicassoTiles 100 Piece Set 100pcs Magnet Building Tiles Clear Magnetic 3D Building Blocks Construction Playboards, Creativity beyond Imagination, Inspirational, Recreational, Educational Conventional
product_meta.description:
Creativity Beyond Imagination! Learning by Playing!
Inspirational:
Fun and entertaining, perfect educational presents for school age children that will never go out of style. 

Recreational:
Entertaining for single or multiple parties, great for parent-to-child bonding with hours of fun quality time. Easy to construct and easy to put away for storage. 

Educational: Learning is Fun!
It's never too early to start developing kids creativity at a young age, PicassoTiles inspire youngsters learning by playing, children will acquire a strong sense of colors, geometrical shapes
feature_bullets: DREAM BIG & BUILD BIG - No limitations, scalable to build as big as desired by adding more pieces to create the master piece. PicassoTiles in colossal styles.

LEARNING BY PLAYING - Never too early to start developing kids creativity. Children can acquire strong sense of color, geometrical shapes including 3D forms numbers counts, magnetic polarities & architectural design at early age.

BONDING BY PLAYING - Entertaining for single or multiple parties and feel the sense of achievement together. Suitable for all ages (3+ and up) by one party of in groups a great way to spend quality time with the family and love ones.

LEARNING IS FUN - Encourage creativity which is the key factor to success in today's ever-changing environments. Fun and entertaining, perfect educational presents for school age children that will never go out of style.
CREATIVITY BEYOND IMAGINATION - Magnet Building Tiles Clear 3D color Magnetic Building Blocks Playboards for preschool, pretend play and more. Easy to construct and easy to put away for storage.
